ContentDescription_V2: Interpretations of early human evolution and migration and the establishment of societies, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ populating the Sahul mega-continent
Comment: New content description to better align with other Historical Knowledge and Understanding sub-strands

ContentDescription_V2: Development and features of early societies, such as the development of technologies, agriculture, trade, social groups, religious beliefs and laws
Comment: New content description to better align with development in historical skills and concepts

ContentDescription_V2: The different methods and sources of evidence used by historians and archaeologists to investigate early societies, and the importance of archaeology and conserving the remains, material culture and heritage of the past
ContentDescription_V1: The different methods and sources used by historians and archaeologists to investigate history and/or a historical mystery; The significance and importance of conserving the remains and heritage of the past
Comment: Refined to include importance of archaeology in a single content description

ContentDescription_V2: Patterns of continuity and change caused by significant events between 600 CE and 1750 CE, including the transformation of the Roman world and the spread of major worldviews
Comment: New content description to better align with development in historical skills and concepts

ContentDescription_V2: Features of the pre-modern world, such as social structures, contact and conflict
Comment: New content description to better align with development in historical skills and concepts

ContentDescription_V1: Changes in society and the perspectives of key groups affected by change including the influence of law and religion
Comment: Removed because this is now an overview; key groups examined in Investigations

SubStrand: Investigation: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ knowledge and understandings (Deep Time to the modern era)
ContentDescription_V2: The diversity of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ knowledge and understanding of the creation of Country and Place and people in oral accounts, stories and artworks
ContentDescription_V1: The significant beliefs, values and practices of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and cultures including trade with other communities, causes and effects of warfare, and death and funerary customs

SubStrand: Investigation: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ knowledge and understandings (Deep Time to the modern era)
ContentDescription_V2: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ responses to environmental processes and changes during Deep Time
ContentDescription_V1: How physical or geographical features influenced the development of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples’ communities, foundational stories and land management practices

SubStrand: Investigation: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ knowledge and understandings (Deep Time to the modern era)
ContentDescription_V2: The features and structures of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities and their continuity and change over time, such as connection to Country and Place, spirituality and kinship systems
ContentDescription_V1: The significance and importance of conserving the remains and heritage of the past
Comment: Broadened the scope to expanded features and structures

SubStrand: Investigation: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ knowledge and understandings (Deep Time to the modern era)
ContentDescription_V2: Significant Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ beliefs and values that shaped, and continue to shape, everyday life, such as the relationships with Country and Place, land, trade, technologies and stories

SubStrand: Investigation: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ knowledge and understandings (Deep Time to the modern era)
ContentDescription_V2: Cultural protocols for maintaining and preserving Country and Place, ancestral remains, cultural artefacts and artworks and shared responsibility for their maintenance, continuing use and preservation
ContentDescription_V1: The importance of conserving the remains of the ancient past, including the heritage, culture and artefacts of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples
Comment: Updated language and provided more specificity for clarity

SubStrand: Investigation: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ knowledge and understandings (Deep Time to the modern era)
ContentDescription_V2: Changing evidence and interpretations of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples as the world’s oldest continuous cultures
The influence of the physical environment on the development of an ancient society
ContentDescription_V1: How physical features influenced the development of the civilisation

ContentDescription_V2: Features and organisation of ancient societies, significant groups, their perspectives and their roles in influencing and changing society
ContentDescription_V1: Changes in society and the perspectives of key groups affected by change including the influence of law and religion

ContentDescription_V2: Significant beliefs, values, places and practices of an ancient society and their continuity and change over time, such as everyday life, worldviews, warfare, or death and funerary customs
ContentDescription_V1: Significant beliefs, values and practices with a particular emphasis on changes to everyday life, cause and effect of warfare, and perspectives of death and funerary customs
Comment: Refined to include language from historical skills and concepts

ContentDescription_V2: Significant events or turning points in an ancient society and their contribution to continuity and change
Comment: New content description. Added to maintain connection to historical skills and concepts

ContentDescription_V2: Causes and consequences of contacts and conflicts within and/or with other societies, resulting in developments such as the conquest of other lands, the expansion of trade and peace treaties
ContentDescription_V1: Causes and effects of contacts and conflicts with other societies and/or peoples, resulting in developments such as expansion of trade, colonisation and war, and spread of beliefs
Comment: Refined to include language from historical skills and concepts

ContentDescription_V2: The role, contribution and achievements of a significant individual or group to change an ancient society
ContentDescription_V1: The role and achievements of a significant individual in an ancient society
Comment: Refined to add more opportunities to focus on groups

ContentDescription_V2: Interpretations of the significance of an ancient society and/or individual and their legacies

ContentDescription_V1: The nature of sources of evidence about ancient Australia and what they reveal about Australia's ancient past, such as the use of resources
Comment: Removed as language about ‘ancient Australia’ no longer connects with VC2

SubStrand: Investigation: Europe and the Mediterranean world (c. 600–1750 CE)
ContentDescription_V2: Significant social, cultural, economic, environmental and political continuity and change in the way of life and the roles and relationships of different groups
ContentDescription_V1: The significant social, cultural, economic, environmental and political changes and continuities in the way of life and the roles and relationships of different groups in society
Comment: Added connection to historical skill of continuity and change

SubStrand: Investigation: Europe and the Mediterranean world (c. 600–1750 CE)
ContentDescription_V2: Causes and consequences of a significant event, development or turning point that contributed to continuity and change

ContentDescription_V2: The role and contribution of a significant individual and/or group to change

SubStrand: Investigation: Europe and the Mediterranean world (c. 600–1750 CE)
ContentDescription_V2: Historical interpretations of an event, individual, group or institution and its legacies

SubStrand: Investigation: Asia and the Pacific region (c. 600–1750 CE)
ContentDescription_V2: Significant social, cultural, economic, environmental and political continuities and changes in the way of life and the roles and relationships of different groups
ContentDescription_V1: The significant social, cultural, economic, environmental and political changes and continuities in the way of life and the roles and relationships of different groups in society; Significant causes and effects of developments and/or cultural achievements that reflect the concentration and/or expansion of wealth and power; One significant challenge and one development faced by the society that caused progress or decline
Comment: Three V1 descriptors consolidated into one V2 descriptor to align with historical skills of continuity and change

SubStrand: Investigation: Asia and the Pacific region (c. 600–1750 CE)
ContentDescription_V2: Causes and consequences of a significant event, development or turning point that contributed to continuity and change

ContentDescription_V2: Experiences and perspectives of rulers and ruled, and the interaction between power and/or authority

ContentDescription_V2: The role, contribution and achievements of a significant individual and/or group to change
ContentDescription_V1: The role and achievements of a significant individual and/or group

ContentDescription_V2: Historical interpretations of an event, individual, group or institution and its legacies
Develop and use historical questions to inform historical investigations
Sequence significant events, individuals, ideas and developments chronologically to explain continuity and change and causes and consequences
ContentDescription_V1: Sequence significant events in chronological order to analyse the causes and effects and identify continuities and changes

ContentDescription_V2: Explain the features, content and context of historical sources
Analyse the value of sources for use as evidence to explain historical significance, continuity and change, and causes and consequences
ContentDescription_V1: Analyse and corroborate sources and ask questions about their accuracy, usefulness and reliability
Comment: Refined to include language for broader focus

ContentDescription_V2: Explain the perspectives, beliefs, values and attitudes of people and groups based on evidence from a range of sources
Analyse historical interpretations and debates
ContentDescription_V1: Analyse the different perspectives of people in the past; Explain different historical interpretations and contested debates about the past
Comment: Combined 2 V1 descriptors and updated command term to ensure progression across bands

ContentDescription_V2: Explain continuity and change
ContentDescription_V1: Describe and explain the broad patterns of change over the period from the Ancient to the Modern World; Identify and explain patterns of continuity and change in society by the way of life
Comment: Combined 2 content descriptions into one, updating command term to ensure progression across bands

ContentDescription_V2: Explain the causes and consequences of significant events, individuals, ideas and developments and their contribution to continuity and change
ContentDescription_V1: Analyse the causes and effects of significant events that caused change and/or a decline over the period; Evaluate the role and achievement of a significant individual, development and/or cultural achievement that led to progress
Comment: Combined 2 content descriptions into one, updating command term to ensure progression across bands

ContentDescription_V2: Analyse the significance of individuals, events, sites, developments and/or cultural achievements
Construct historical interpretations using appropriate historical concepts, terms, knowledge, conventions and evidence from historical sources
